name: raged
content:

past simple and past participle of
rage
C2 to speak very angrily to someone: He raged at (= spoke angrily to) us for forgetting to order a replacement.
C2 to happen in a strong or violent way: The storm raged outside. A flu epidemic is raging in/through local schools. The argument rages on (= continues strongly).
